title: Luminary Tour: Hartwell Memorial Window
hero_caption: Design attributed to Agnes F. Northrop for Tiffany Studios. Hartwell Memorial Window (detail), 1917.
short_description: Connect with fellow Luminary members on a guided small-group tour of the arts of the Americas galleries culminating in a visit to the monumental Hartwell Memorial Window.
list_description: Connect with fellow Luminary members on a guided small-group tour of the arts of the Americas galleries culminating in a visit to the monumental Hartwell Memorial Window.
description:
Connect with fellow Luminary members on a guided small-group tour of the arts of the Americas galleries culminating in a visit to the monumental Hartwell Memorial Window. You’ll delve deep into the new installation, a technical marvel in the medium of glass and a work of stunning beauty that is attributed to Tiffany’s foremost landscape window designer, Agnes Northrop.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this tour requires advance registration and is limited to eight participants. The tour lasts approximately 50 minutes. View all upcoming Luminary tours.

Physical distancing and other visiting policies must be observed. These include but are not limited to wearing a face covering and not attending if you are experiencing any COVID-19 symptoms.

Coat and bag check, dining, and valet services are currently unavailable.

Find further information on What to Expect on our website.

Contact Us

If you have questions or are interested in learning more about Luminary membership, we’d be delighted to hear from you. Please contact us at (312) 443-3735 or luminary@artic.edu.
buy_button_caption:
$50 per person

This tour is limited to eight participants.
